content.html:
P, S, A, and M Modes

Front Command Dial Roles by Mode



The roles assigned to the front command dial during shooting
can be chosen using 8 BUTTON/DIAL SETTING > COMMAND
DIAL SETTING (□□ 226). At default settings, the dial can be used
in the following three roles:


● FRONT COMMAND DIAL 1: S.S. (PROGRAM SHIFT) (S.S.
● FRONT COMMAND DIAL 2: APERTURE ( F
● FRONT COMMAND DIAL 3: EXPOSURE COMPENSATION



Role assigned to front command dial
S.S.F
P (PROGRAM AE)Program shiftProgram shift1 Aperture 2, 3Exposure compensation4
S (SHUTTER PRIORITY AE)Shutter speedAperture3
A (APERTURE PRIORITY AE)NoneNone
M (MANUAL)Shutter speedAperture3None
Press the center of the front command dial to cycle through roles
1, 2, and 3.

1 Shutter speed dial set to P.
2 Shutter speed dial set to A.
3 Lens with no aperture ring, or lens equipped with an aperture ring set to


A (auto) with COMMAND selected for 8 BUTTON/DIAL SETTING >
APERTURE RING SETTING (A). Aperture adjustment via front command dial
not otherwise available.
4 Exposure compensation dial rotated to C.

To adjust sensitivity using the front command dial, assign ISO to any
of the front command dial roles 1 through 3 using BUTTON/DIAL
SETTING > COMMAND DIAL SETTING (� 226).


5

Photographs

content.markdown:
P, S, A, and M Modes

# Front Command Dial Roles by Mode

The roles that can be performed by the
front command dial in each mode are
listed below.

![image](/image/placeholder)


The roles assigned to the front command dial during shooting
can be chosen using 8 BUTTON/DIAL SETTING > COMMAND
DIAL SETTING (□□ 226). At default settings, the dial can be used
in the following three roles:

- ● FRONT COMMAND DIAL 1: S.S. (PROGRAM SHIFT) (S.S.
- ● FRONT COMMAND DIAL 2: APERTURE ( F 
- ● FRONT COMMAND DIAL 3: EXPOSURE COMPENSATION


Press the center of the front command dial to cycle through roles
1, 2, and 3.

|  | Role assigned to front command dial | Role assigned to front command dial | Role assigned to front command dial |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| S.S. | F |  |  |
| P (PROGRAM AE) | Program shift | Program shift1 Aperture 2, 3 | Exposure compensation4 |
| S (SHUTTER PRIORITY AE) | Shutter speed | Aperture3 | Exposure compensation4 |
| A (APERTURE PRIORITY AE) | None | None | Exposure compensation4 |
| M (MANUAL) | Shutter speed | Aperture3 | None |


1 Shutter speed dial set to P.
2 Shutter speed dial set to A.
3 Lens with no aperture ring, or lens equipped with an aperture ring set to

A (auto) with COMMAND selected for 8 BUTTON/DIAL SETTING >
APERTURE RING SETTING (A). Aperture adjustment via front command dial
not otherwise available.
4 Exposure compensation dial rotated to C.

To adjust sensitivity using the front command dial, assign ISO to any
of the front command dial roles 1 through 3 using  BUTTON/DIAL
SETTING > COMMAND DIAL SETTING (� 226).
